Happy ending: You and Riley decide you want to target a promotion and to ask for more work projects. You're excited to be invested in your career again. It feels good to have a goal to work toward. A few months later, your manager tells you you're doing great! You're proud of yourself.
Middling ending: You and Riley target a promotion, but you feel unsure about this.
Wistful paragraph: You keep thinking about Riley and about work. Where would you end up if you applied yourself there a bit more?

Happy ending: You and Robin decide to take painting more seriously. You block off a couple evenings a week to build out your portfolio. You start building your social media presence. A few months later, your friend asks if youâ€™d be able to paint a mural for their cafe. Absolutely! Life is so good!!!
Middling ending: You and Robin go all in on mural painting, but your heart just isn't in it.
Wistful paragraph: You think about Robin and all the walls you'd love to paint. When will you ever have time for that?

Happy ending: You and River decide to seriously consider moving to New York. You look at job opportunities there and figure you may as well apply and see what happens. To your surprise, one pans out. You take the offer and start thinking about housing. How exciting!
Middling ending: You and River look into moving to New York, but you get nervous. Since when have you ever wanted to move to New York? But it feels like such a good opportunity. So why aren't you more excited?
Wistful paragraph: You think about River and the big world out there. Will it ever be a good time to explore? Will it ever be the practical choice?

Happy ending: You and Rory decide to pull back a bit at work so you have more time for yourself and your loved ones. You take a week off to visit home. You start leaving work before 6PM. You reach out to some friends and ask when they're free to catch up. You still wake up with your heart racing, but you somehow feel more at peace.
Middling ending: You and Rory start making plans to move back home. You have mixed feelings about this, but it feels like a responsible choice. Your parents are happy yet confused by why you'd want to move back home right now. They can tell something's up.
Wistful paragraph: Your mind flickers to Rory often. You think about everyone in your life and how you're more absent than you'd like to be. What's the point of all this if you can't even be there for your people?

Happy ending: You and Ronnie decide to pick tennis back up again. Some of your friends play fairly well, and it's pushing you to be better. You look forward to tennis nearly every day after work now. You sign up for lessons. It's nice to be out there.
Middling ending: You and Ronnie pick tennis up again, but you're always so sad on the court. Why?
Wistful paragraph: You think of Ronnie now and then. You wish your tennis dreams had panned out. You wonder if you should pick it up again, but you just have so much else you should do. Where will the time come from?
